title: 16-year-old suffers accidental gunshot wound
content:
WASILLA — Alaska State Troopers say a 16-year-old boy was hospitalized with “non life-threatening injuries” after he was accidentally shot late Thursday night at a residence on Mutiny Circle in Wasilla.
According to an online dispatch, a 17-year-old boy was handling the weapon when it discharged, hitting the 16-year-old, who was taken to Mat-Su Regional Medical Center for treatment.
While at the location, troopers found Jared Mayer, 20, of Wasilla, was wanted on an original charge of minor consuming alcohol. Mayer was arrested and taken to Mat-Su Pretrial on $100 bail.
